item.title: [DISTRELEC-3867] Browser-Caching nutzen
item.description:
Browser-Caching nutzen
Das Festlegen eines Ablaufdatums oder eines Höchstalters in den HTTP-Headern für statische Ressourcen weist den Browser an, zuvor heruntergeladene Ressourcen über die lokale Festplatte anstatt über das Netzwerk zu laden.

Nutzen Sie Browser-Caching für die folgenden cachefähigen Ressourcen:

http://www.distrelec.ch/…mages/landscape_medium/27/4f/950274f.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…ape_medium/59/8f/microsoft-269-16150.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…_e/ps/crealogix-g75_wv-7640110955123.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…cape_medium/_t/if/multi-contact-ls-4.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…f/profilgehause-clamshell-alustyle-6.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…turer_logo/54/08/raspberry_logo_cmyk.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…turer_logo/_e/ps/crealogix_logo_cmyk.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…cturer_logo/_t/if/ebmpapst_logo_cmyk.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…rer_logo/_t/if/microsoft_logo_bitmap.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…r_logo/_t/if/multi_contact_logo_cmyk.jpg (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/_ui/all/cache/base-head.min.js (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/_ui/all/cache/base-one.min.css (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/_ui/all/cache/base-two.min.css (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/_ui/all/cache/base.min.js (Ablaufdatum nicht festgelegt)

http://www.distrelec.ch/…all/cache/dyn-jquery-caroufredsel.min.js (Ablaufdatum nicht

comments.comment:
CMS Bilder

Ablaufdatum kann auf unendlich gesetzt werden,
da neue Bilder einen neuen Key bekommen.

-> Aufwand für die Apache config ca. 2h

PIM/Produkt Bilder

Ablaufdatum muss von Distrelec definiert werden.

-> Aufwand für die Apache config ca. 2h

CSS / JavaScript

Damit wir das Ablaufdatum möglichst hoch machen können müssen wir beim Deployment einen Key generieren und ihn als parameter an die CSS-/JS- Dateien anhängen.

Dann können wir das Ablaufdatum auf unendlich einstellen und haben trotzdem nach jedem Deployment sofrt die neusten Files.

-> Aufwand für (generieren, anpassen im Template, Apache config) ca. 10h

@Florian

  • Bitte Ablaufdatum für Bilder vom PIM definieren.
  • Bitte weiteres Vorgehen festlegen.

René,
could you please start with this task.

Can we quickly talk about the expire date?

Einstellungen:

  • default -> 1 Woche
  • PIM-Bilder -> 1 Woche
  • CSS/JS (base*) -> 1 Jahr (sie bekommen neu bei jedem Deployment einen neuen GET-Parameter und werden dann sofort neu geladen)
  • /media -> 1 Jahr (neue Media bekommen immer auch einen neuen Key)

<Location /Web>
ExpiresDefault "access plus 1 month"
</Location>

<Location /_ui/all/cache/>
ExpiresDefault "access plus 1 year"
</Location>

<Location /media>
ExpiresDefault "access plus 1 year"
</Location>
done

Once the page loaded into the browser cache, we have very few requests left (Homepage: 46 before, 8 now). Excellent!!! (see screenshot.png)

However, there are two bad guys left:
http://test.distrelec.ch/_ui/all/media/favicon.ico
http://test.distrelec.ch/_ui/all/media/sprites.png?......

They reside in /_ui/all/media/ that does not get a future expires header.
Can you try to eliminate them, too?

<Location /_ui/all/media>
ExpiresDefault "access plus 1 week"
</Location>
sprites will now be cached too.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4171] Checkout, Step2 // Delivery options
item.description: The labeling of the delivery-options should be changed. See screenshot for the correct values.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4151] Wrong display in conformation email
item.description:
Win 7 / Firefox / TS-32
Shipping address is displayed incoreetly. As well as the article pics aren't displayed. See printscreen

comments.comment: Error appears for Switzerland/Austria/Italy

email-orderConfirmationBody.vm updated.
We have to reimport all email-content_XX.impex for all countries after the next deployment (post installation)

I have create a new customer and placed an order. I can see all pictures.
Can you check with an other email please? Maybe the pictures are blocked on gmail?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4143] Correct mapping of shipping methods (SAP - hybris)
item.description:
At the moment, the labels for the shipping methods don't correspond with the actual shipping methods.

methods are:

  • Economy to door (Order normally leaves Elfa Distrelec within 3 days)
  • Normal to door (Order normally leaves Elfa Distrelec the same day)
  • Express (Contact our Customer Service)

visible is

  • Express 10 ltl
  • Emergency 900 ltl
  • Mail Order 17 ltl

the prices per method don't make sense, so the mapping seems wrong.
item.summary: Correct mapping of shipping methods (SAP - hybris)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4137] Checkout - Pickup Location Description (LT)
item.description: If the availability-check is launched, the colours of the message-text does not correspond to the shown icon. For example orange icon, green text. Aswell there is no lt-contact-information visible but I think this is part of the properties.

comments.comment:
Nabil,
The color of the text has already been changed by Laurent.
Could you please change the Adress details?

Please provide me the warehouse address details.

actually we have it like this in the impex files

;7711;?;?;;Vilnius;;":?? - :";": - :";false;

(lt)Pkcup at Distrelec Vilnius“
=> "Vilniaus parduotuvė"

Gatvé:
Visorių g. 2

Miestat
Vilnius

Telefonas
8~5 2789259

Pirm.-penkt.
8:00-17:0

Item „Sa.“ -> remove

(based on https://www.elfa.se/elfa3~lt_lt/elfa/init.do?page=contact/shops)

Done.

Should the availability button always be at the same place when the pickup point is close on saturday?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4131] Fast switching of payment method in checkout cause a 500 http error.
item.description:
When the switch of the available radiobutton (see screenshoot) for payment method is too fast than we get a backend error, because the payment mode are sent in a concatenated way.

We get the exception that you see in the attachment.
item.summary: Fast switching of payment method in checkout cause a 500 http error.

comments.comment: Jan, is it possible to prevent further requests until reload, once a different payment / shipping method has been selected?
yeah its possible..I will start doing it right now.
Done. Can be tested after next deployment.

Still same issue after more than around 6 clicks.
Error 500 appears.
Not sure if the fix was actually in today's deployment. Needs to be verified
Verified by Jan: it was not part of the last deployment. Please re-test after the next one.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4106] Anchor Link Datasheets
item.description: Could you please replace the direct link to the main data sheet with an anchor link to the download accordion?

comments.comment:
Hi

The link name, icon and link are changed :
Before

<c:if test="${not empty datasheetURL}">
	<li class="pdf"><a href="<c:url value="${datasheetURL}" />" name="${datasheetName}" target="_blank" ><spring:message code="product.accordion.datasheet.pdf" /><i></i></a></li>
</c:if>

After

<c:if test="${not empty product.downloads}">
	<li><a href="#download"><spring:message code="product.accordion.download" /><i></i></a></li>
</c:if>

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4044] LT: Icons for unavailable payment methods are showing
item.description:
For all elfa countries, the following two credit card options are available:

  • Visa
  • MasterCard

However, in the CMS, also icons for other methods are maintained. The extra ones need to be removed before go-live
item.summary: LT: Icons for unavailable payment methods are showing

comments.comment:
Hi Stefanie

can you pelase take care of this one?

as indicated earleir, I have issues accessing the Cockpit with the new machine.

If you have questions please address them to me.

Hi Oana, mhm. I need a bit more information here. Could you please indicate the template that needs to be changed. And also upload the necessary icons or the ID of the pictures stored in the console? Thanks Stef
Sorry Oana, I need just a bit more information here. Thanks Stef

The issue is that there are too many, not too few images.
Checking where this needs to be changed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2463] Optimize region cache
item.description:
During the load tests the overall cache statistics show a hit/ miss rate of 99%. In total this value
is good but still needs to be investigated in more detail detail. Only 68% of all Product data
requests and not a single PriceRow request were answered by the cache. The standard cache sizes
have not been changed although the cache size is not constrained as Distrelec has licensed the
hybris High Performance option.

Recommendation: Improve the cache hit/miss ration by changing its parameters,
e.g. size or eviction strategies.
see https://wiki.hybris.com/display/release4/Region+Cache

comments.comment: We wait for experience with CH traffic before increasing cache from 100'000 to 300'000 entries.

Adrian,
do we have first conclusions from CH traffic analysis?

Increasing the cache size does currently not make much sense. With 100'000 items we reach a hit ratio of about 95%. After increasing cache size to 300'000 items the hit ratio increased only little to 96%. However, we have to find out why certain items are rather being cached. E.g. StockLevel, ProductFeature and DistSalesOrgProduct have a very poor hit ratio.

=> 5% cache misses generate still a big load on the database. Current numbers: 14'637'426 misses during 24h => average 170 sql statements per second (on every server).

1) Change Strategy from FIFO to "last touched"
2) check cache hit ratio
3) increase cache size
4) check

  • memory consumption
  • cache hit ratio
  • average 170 sql statements per second (on every server).
  • would be great to be able to check the load on the DB before and after the change

Before we start optimizing, I checked the cache hit ratio again (01.05.2014). On all nodes 1..4 we have the same ratio values:

  • 99% hit ratio for typesystemCacheRegion
  • 97% hit ratio for entityCacheRegion (100% of cache size used)
  • 95% hit ratio for queryCacheRegion

@Adi

How did you check the values of:

  • statements per second (hmc) ?
  • cache hit ratio (hmc,jconsole) ?

I assume the "memory consumption" will be OK since you already increased to 300000 item in cache.

Did you already change the strategy (FIFO) ?

Thanks
René

@René:

  • Statements per second (just a roughly number) => switch on JDBC logging for 1 min and count lines
  • Cache hit ratio can be found in hAC => http://10.191.20.141:9001/hac/monitoring/cache
  • No, I did not yet change the eviction policy.

I did a short test using 300'000 items. But those days the number of sessions were lower!

My recommendation:

1) Change cache strategy for next deployment.
2) Monitor the system the day after
3) Increase cache for the next deployment
3) Monitor the system the day after

Effort approx. 1PT

@Florian

Bitte das weitere Vorgehen definieren.
Bitte umsetzen.

Changed for R1.1 (to have time to monitor after the deployment) :

regioncache.entityregion.evictionpolicy=LFU
regioncache.querycacheregion.size=40000
Auf Test sind die Anpassung OK!

only the first part is done yet!
-> reopen
No negative impact from changing to LFU!

Checked hit rate again on prod node 1+2:

99% hit ratio for typesystemCacheRegion
97% hit ratio for entityCacheRegion (100% of cache size used)
96% hit ratio for queryCacheRegion

Increased entity cache size to 300000 objects:

regioncache.entityregion.size=300000
done

Although we increased the query cache size from 20'000 to 40'000 there is a huge number of SQL statements performed against the database (ca. 700 stmts/s on one single node). see attached jdbc_HP-Q1_20140519.xlsx

Let's try to increase the query cache size again to 200'000 elements. The memory consumption will be around 400MB. (7897 query cache items use 14.5MB => 200'000 will use 367MB)

Query cache with old settings (FIFO, 40'000): 5'476'000'000 hits / 191'000'000 misses / 96% ratio (after 5d 22h 50min)
Query cache with old settings (LFU, 200'000): ???

GC behavior with old settings (FIFO, 40'000): Every 22.5min stop the world for 4.2s (avg over 6days)
GC behavior with new settings (LFU, 200'000): ???
jconsole_prod_app01_20140521.png shows memory consumption before/after changing the settings. Number of sessions: @22:15=11'000, @23:50=10'500
